snippet: Justice Sonia Sotomayor admits that it took her a while to adjust from life in New York to the slower pace in Washington. And do not ask her about her experiences with takeout.
abstract: Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor memoir My Beloved World is steeped in vivid memories of New York City and is exceptionally frank account of challenges that she faced during her ascent from public housing project to Supreme Court.
lead_paragraph: Justice Sonia Sotomayor admits that it took her a while to adjust from life in New York to the slower pace in Washington. And do not ask her about her experiences with takeout.

headline.seo: Sonia Sotomayor Makes Herself at Home in Washington
headline.main: Washington Is Home (for Now at Least), but Sotomayor Stays True to New York
headline.print_headline: Washington Is Home (for Now at Least), but Sotomayor Stays True to New York
